meanings.definition: A person or thing that expels or forces out something.
meanings.sent1: The expeller of the group always made sure everyone left on time.
meanings.sent2: The vacuum cleaner was an efficient expeller of dust and dirt.
meanings.sent3: The expeller of jokes in our class always had us laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice acted as an expeller of silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The expeller of bad vibes, she always brought positivity wherever she went.

meanings.definition: A machine used to extract oil from seeds or nuts by pressing them.
meanings.sent1: The expeller in the factory worked tirelessly to extract oil from seeds.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use an expeller to get oil from sunflower seeds.
meanings.sent3: The expeller in the kitchen seemed to have a mind of its own, pressing seeds with gusto.
meanings.sent4: The expeller hummed softly as it squeezed every drop of oil from the nuts.
meanings.sent5: The expeller's metal arms pressed down firmly, extracting oil with precision.
